keyEvents.title: Usopp's Stand to Protect His Village
keyEvents.description: Usopp makes his tearful stand to protect Syrup Village from the Black Cat Pirates despite his fear.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Usopp's deep connection to his home village and his willingness to risk everything to protect it.

keyEvents.title: Jango's Pursuit Through the Village
keyEvents.description: Jango chases Kaya through the forests of Syrup Village, creating additional danger for the villagers.
keyEvents.significance: The village itself becomes a battleground as the conflict spreads throughout its forests and paths.

description: A peaceful village in the East Blue, home to Usopp and the wealthy Kaya family. The village is known for its tranquil atmosphere and is protected by Usopp and his small crew of friends.
significance: Syrup Village is where Usopp grew up and serves as the setting for the conflict with the Black Cat Pirates. It represents the peaceful life that Kuro seeks and that Usopp fights to protect.

keyEvents.title: Main Battle Location
keyEvents.description: The northern slope serves as the primary battlefield for the climactic confrontations between Luffy vs Kuro and Zoro vs Buchi.
keyEvents.significance: This location is where the fate of Syrup Village and Kaya's fortune is decided through combat.

description: A sloping area on the northern part of Syrup Village where the Black Cat Pirates planned to launch their attack. It becomes the primary battlefield for the final confrontation.
significance: The northern slope is strategically important as it was where Kuro planned to have his crew attack, and where the decisive battles of the arc take place.

statusHistory.description: Battle site on Syrup Village's northern area
